intro: Dissochaeta rostrata var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy rostrated dissochaeta, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
